alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:39PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Haskell, Sequoyah and northern Le Flore Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 539 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Haskell, Sequoyah and northern LeFlore counties, with slow and erratic motion. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Stigler... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Spiro... Arkoma... Vian... Keota... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... Gans... Marble City... Tamaha... Moffett... Brushy... Brushy Lake State Park... Short... Mc Curtain... Cowlington... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 291 and 328. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
